com.badlogic.gdx.ai.btree

Class BehaviorTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.ai.btree.Task<E>
      • com.badlogic.gdx.ai.btree.BehaviorTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - type of the blackboard object that tasks use to read or modify game state

    public class BehaviorTree<E>
extends Task<E>
    The behavior tree itself.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BehaviorTree

        public BehaviorTree()
        Creates a BehaviorTree with no root task and no blackboard object. Both the root task and the blackboard object must be set before running this behavior tree, see addChild() and setObject() respectively.

      • BehaviorTree

        public BehaviorTree(Task<E> rootTask)
        Creates a behavior tree with a root task and no blackboard object. Both the root task and the blackboard object must be set before running this behavior tree, see addChild() and setObject() respectively.
        Parameters:
        rootTask - the root task of this tree. It can be null.

      • BehaviorTree

        public BehaviorTree(Task<E> rootTask,
                    E object)
        Creates a behavior tree with a root task and a blackboard object. Both the root task and the blackboard object must be set before running this behavior tree, see addChild() and setObject() respectively.
        Parameters:
        rootTask - the root task of this tree. It can be null.
        object - the blackboard. It can be null.

      • step

        public void step()
        This method should be called when game entity needs to make decisions: call this in game loop or after a fixed time slice if the game is realtime, or on entity's turn if the game is turn-based
